content: st 4 double_crochet 33 row 12 sdc in first 5 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 1 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 3 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 3 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 3 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 3 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 1 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 1 double_crochet chain 1 skip st 4 double_crochet 33 row 13-15 sdc in first double_crochet across 33 row 16-17 repeat row 2 do not fasten_off chain 1 and continue on to border border i did a single_crochet border all the way around but you could certainly jazz it up with another i find that working 3 single_crochet per every 2 row is best to keep the sides nice and straight i also put three single_crochet into the corner stitches stitch count for the border doesn t really matter as long as it isn t ruffling or causing the edge to tighten up too much fasten_off and leave 4-6 inches of tail weave in your end in three directions using your darning needle the finished size is about 9 5 x 10 inches but this may differ depending on your gauge feel free to share the link to this pattern but do not use my photos or reproduce this pattern as your own
